scope: Incorporates the European Convention on Human Rights into UK domestic law

articles_incorporated.Article_3: Prohibition of torture and inhuman treatment
articles_incorporated.Article_4: Prohibition of slavery and forced labour
articles_incorporated.Article_8: Right to respect for private and family life
articles_incorporated.Article_9: Freedom of thought, conscience and religion
articles_incorporated.Article_12: Right to marry and found a family

key_provisions.section_3: Interpretation of legislation - Courts must interpret legislation compatibly with Convention rights where possible
key_provisions.section_4: Declaration of incompatibility - Courts can declare legislation incompatible with Convention rights
key_provisions.section_6: Acts of public authorities - Must not act incompatibly with Convention rights
key_provisions.section_7: Proceedings - Right to bring proceedings for breach of Convention rights
key_provisions.section_8: Judicial remedies - Courts can grant appropriate relief
key_provisions.section_10: Remedial orders - Power to amend legislation declared incompatible

horizontal_effect.public_authorities: Directly binding on all public authorities
horizontal_effect.private_individuals: Indirect effect through interpretation of other laws
horizontal_effect.courts_and_tribunals: Must act compatibly with Convention rights
